revised_title: Thomas Alan Stephenson: A Life in Science and Botany
tldr: Thomas Alan Stephenson was a British botanist and zoologist known for his work on sea anemones and orchids. Born in 1898, he grew up in a cultured home with a father who was a notable botanist. Stephenson's scientific education was limited at school, but his interest in field botany and zoology was nurtured by his father and a close friendship with Dr. H. Drinkwater. He attended University College, Aberystwyth, where he studied under the guidance of Professor H. J. Fleure. Stephenson made significant contributions to the study of sea anemones and collaborated with his father on orchid research. He married Anne Wood, who became a close collaborator in his scientific work. Stephenson's artistic and intellectual gifts, along with his passion for science, made him a notable figure in the fields of botany and zoology.
